author: EFE
title: Albares defiende a la OTAN en Praga al asegurar que es "absolutamente indispensable"
text:
Albares defiende a la OTAN en Praga al asegurar que es "absolutamente indispensable"
Praga, 16 abr (EFE).- El ministro de Asuntos Exteriores, José Manuel Albares, defendió este miércole...
Praga, 16 abr (EFE).- El ministro de Asuntos Exteriores, José Manuel Albares, defendió este miércoles durante una visita a la República Checa a la OTAN como una organización "absolutamente indispensable", aunque reconoció que Europa debe avanzar en autonomía y soberanía para mantener su seguridad. IMÁGENES: MARTIN DIVISEK

author: @philstarnews
title: Banchero and Magic withstand Mitchell's big night to stay alive against Cavaliers | Philstar.com
text:
LOS ANGELES, United States -- Paolo Banchero and the Orlando Magic dominated late to overcome a heroic 50-point performance from Cleveland's Donovan Mitchell and beat the Cavaliers 103-96 on Friday (Saturday, Manila time,) forcing a decisive game seven in their NBA Eastern Conference playoff series.
Banchero scored 10 of his 27 points in the fourth quarter for Orlando, drilling a three-pointer that put the Magic ahead for good with 3:39 left to play in a back-and-forth battle in which neither team could build a double-digit lead.
Franz Wagner added 26 points for Orlando and Jalen Suggs made six three-pointers on the way to 22.
Orlando, which had won games three and four at home by an average of 30.5 points, never looked like producing another blowout.
But with Banchero leading the way they had enough at the end to overcome Mitchell, who was clearly troubled by a nagging knee injury but had all 18 of the Cavs' fourth-quarter points.
With the series tied at three games apiece, the Cavs host game seven on Sunday. To advance to a second-round series against the Boston Celtics the Magic will have to do what neither team has done this series and win on the road.
Cleveland players, who made just one of 14 from three-point range, dominated the paint to keep it close.
Down by four at halftime, the Cavs continued to attack the rim, authoring a 13-0 scoring run to take a 62-55 lead.
Mitchell briefly departed the court in the third quarter favoring his knee, but he returned to close the period with a floater at the buzzer that sent Cleveland into the fourth quarter with a 78-73 advantage.
The lead would change hands five times in the final period before Banchero broke a tie and the Magic pulled away.
Darius Garland added 21 points for Cleveland, who were without center Jarrett Allen because of a rib contusion.
Friday's other game saw the Dallas Mavericks, with a 3-2 series lead over the Los Angeles Clippers, trying to close out their Western Conference series at home.

author: Marie H.
title: En dessous de ce salaire, votre revenu est jugé "indécent", selon une étude
text: En dessous de ce salaire, votre revenu est jugé "indécent", selon une étudemis à jour le 29 novembre 2024 à 18:45 Ce salaire est désormais nécessaire pour vivre décemment, selon un chercheur à l'Institut de recherches économiques et sociales (IRES). L’inflation n’est peut-être plus galopante, mais elle reste bien présente. En octobre 2024, le taux d'inflation en France s'est établi à 1,2 % sur un an, un chiffre relativement modéré comparé aux niveaux élevés observés en 2023, où l'inflation annuelle avait atteint 4,9 %. Si ces taux ne parlent pas à tout le monde, leurs conséquences, en revanche, touchent une grande majorité de Français dont les habitudes de consommation ont dû être revues. En décembre dernier, un sondage OpinionWay pour Bonial, plateforme numérique regroupant catalogues promotionnels, bons plans et offres des grandes enseignes, révélait que près de 30 % de la population française ne parvenait pas à boucler ses fins de mois. "Si l’inflation est moins forte, elle ne recule pas, et les prix ne sont pas revenus à la normale", avait expliqué Laurent Landel, président de Bonial. Du reste, l’étude a mis en évidence qu’un Français sur trois (35 %) considérait ne pas disposer des moyens nécessaires pour vivre décemment. Quel salaire pour "bien vivre" ? Qu’est-ce que vivre décemment ? Si cette notion peut varier en fonction de critères économiques et sociaux, elle signifie par chez nous disposer des ressources nécessaires pour subvenir à ses besoins essentiels, comme l’alimentation, le logement et les soins de santé. À noter que "vivre décemment" inclut aussi la possibilité de se permettre des loisirs et d’avoir un minimum de confort matériel. Enfin, cela implique de pouvoir faire face aux imprévus sans risquer de se retrouver en situation de précarité. Parlons clair, parlons chiffres. D’après le dernier baromètre de l'Observatoire Société et Consommation (ObSoCo), publié en mars 2024 pour BforBank, les Français auraient précisément besoin de 897 euros en plus par mois pour "bien vivre". Selon l’ObSoCo, le "bien-être financier" repose sur plusieurs critères : le fait de ne jamais être à découvert (pour 93 % des sondés) ou encore celui de mettre de l'argent de côté chaque mois (85 %). Un salaire qui couvre toutes les dépenses relatives aux besoins quotidiens En 2015, l'Observatoire national de la pauvreté et de l'exclusion sociale (ONPES) avait commencé à partager des "budgets de référence" annuels évaluant le coût du panier de biens et de services nécessaires pour accéder à un niveau de vie qualifié de "minimum décent". Ceux-ci portaient sur des dépenses relatives aux besoins quotidiens, à savoir : se loger, se nourrir, se déplacer, s'habiller, se soigner, se divertir, communiquer... Après la dissolution de l’ONPES en 2019, l'Institut de recherches économiques et sociales (IRES) a actualisé le fameux panier. Selon ses dernières données, datant de 2022, les revenus nécessaires pour vivre décemment étaient estimés à 1 634 euros pour une personne seule et à 3 744 euros pour un couple avec deux enfants, après impôts et prestations sociales éventuelles. Vivre décemment avec un salaire équivalent au Smic ? Avec 11 % d’inflation accumulée depuis 2022, le budget a considérablement augmenté. "À l'été 2024, les sommes dont devaient disposer les Français pour avoir un minimum de vie décent étaient d'environ 1 800 euros pour une personne seule et de 4 150 euros pour un couple avec deux enfants", précise Pierre Concialdi, chercheur à l’IRES, dans un récent article du Figaro Emploi. Actuellement, les personnes travaillant à temps plein au Smic, avec un revenu net de 1 398 euros, ne disposent donc pas de ressources suffisantes pour atteindre ce niveau de vie minimum décent, hors éventuelles prestations sociales. "Ce sont les familles monoparentales avec deux enfants ainsi que les personnes seules qui enregistrent les plus hauts risques", souligne l’expert.

author: The New York Times - By Stephanie Nolen and Emily Anthes
title: Countries Agree on Treaty Aimed at Preventing Global Health Crises | Flipboard
text:
Countries Agree on Treaty Aimed at Preventing Global Health Crises The World Health Organization finally reached a compromise on a pandemic treaty after three years of talks. The United States withdrew from negotiations after President Trump took office. After three years of contentious negotiations, the member nations of the World Health Organization have agreed …
The New York Times - By Stephanie Nolen and Emily Anthes • 1m

author: Katherine Terrell
title: Saints' Ryan Ramczyk uncertain of NFL future due to cartilage defect - ESPN
text: METAIRIE, La. -- [New Orleans Saints](/nfl/team/_/name/no/new-orleans-saints) right tackle [Ryan Ramczyk](https://www.espn.com/nfl/player/_/id/3917676/ryan-ramczyk) said he has a cartilage defect in his knee that has cast uncertainty on his NFL future beyond the 2023 season. The 29-year-old player, who missed the past two games with the knee injury, said he's going to talk with doctors in the offseason to see whether there is anything that could fix the issues that have lingered for the past three seasons. "I don't know," Ramczyk said about a possible fix. "I think those are the discussions we are going to have, that need to be had, and we'll go from there. ... I'll talk with surgeons, doctors, get as much as information as I can and then just make the best decision." Ramczyk said that there is not a lot of cartilage left in the injured knee and that the wear and tear of playing in the NFL has taken its toll. "This year it's bugged me a little bit more than it has in the past," he said. "At some point, I just couldn't play anymore." Ramczyk said it was frustrating to have what he described as a "nagging problem," especially after entering this season with optimism that he could manage the injury. He did not miss a game to injury in his first four NFL seasons, but then missed seven games in 2021 due to his knee. He did not have surgery, and he controlled the problem with injections in the 2022 offseason. He played all of the 2022 season without much incident. "Last year was good. ... My knee was good. This offseason was good, I thought," Ramczyk said. The Saints have managed Ramczyk's workload this season by giving him a rest day during every practice week. Pain management, however, has been an issue since Week 1. "It really was Week 1 that my knee lit up," Ramczyk said. "So, kind of dealing with it all year. ... After that last [game], I think it was Carolina, I just couldn't go anymore." He and the Saints are taking things week by week to see whether he could return for the season finale, or a playoff game, if the Saints make it to the postseason. The 2017 first-round pick out of Wisconsin signed a five-year, $96 million extension in 2021 that made him the highest-paid right tackle in the league. He still has three years remaining on that deal. "I feel like I'm not done yet. I feel like I still want to play," Ramczyk said. "I feel like I'm still passionate about the game. When you think about it like that, my mind frame is, 'I want to play, and I want to keep doing it, so what can I do to get better, to not have this happen in-season?'" There will be significant salary cap implications for the Saints if Ramczyk retires. His cap number of $27 million will be the Saints' second-highest number in 2024, and the team is projected to be significantly over the cap again. Releasing Ramczyk before June 1 would result in a $32 million dead money hit due to the prorated signing bonus amounts remaining on his deal. When former Saints quarterback Drew Brees retired in 2021, the Saints lowered his salary to the veteran minimum, allowing them to spend in free agency and spread out his cap hit over two years. Ramczyk will enter the 2024 offseason with a base salary of $17 million -- $6.5 million of which was guaranteed for injury, and that portion will become fully guaranteed on the third day of the 2024 league year.

author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: No More Phone Tag Provides Flat-Rate, Apartment, and Medical Answering Services | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: Easy flow of communication is crucial when handling the requirements of clients, customers, or patients. Through trusted call-answering solutions, service providers can respond to different needs seamlessly. No More Phone Tag is a leading automated call answering system providing trusted solutions that help service providers communicate with their clients and vice versa. The system offers service providers an easy medium to engage clients and customers better. Walter Lundstrom built an automated call answering system for service providers from various fields. Their services are offered to doctors, pediatricians, property management companies, physicians, healthcare services, OBGYNS, and medical offices. In response to a query about their services, a spokesperson of No More Phone Tag commented, “Businesses and establishments must be reachable and responsive, as their customers can require emergency services. We are here to make this easily achievable through our call-answering system. With over 30 years in the industry, we have been providing small & large businesses, organizations, and private offices with trusted answering services. By paying close attention to the needs of our clients, we continue to improve our solutions. We also ensure that we have no missed or inaccurately routed calls, which cause many problems for clients, especially in a life-and-death situation. We are a client-focused answering service company, and we put our clients' messages first, providing them with 24/7 answering services.” No More Phone Tag offers standard call answering services. The client-centric call answering service has reliable resources to handle over 600,000 calls monthly. They charge their customers a flat rate, as they do not want them to put their patients at risk because they cannot afford their call answering services. There are no hidden costs and setup fees. Their customers can make unlimited calls at a flat rate of $69. Based on their experience in the property management field, they also know how to separate urgent maintenance calls from less urgent ones, and if their customer's technical team cannot answer, they will escalate immediately. Therefore, those interested in this flat - rate answering services pricing can visit their website for more details. The spokesperson added, “We recognize how difficult it can get to manage an apartment. Our apartment answering service is designed to make your job easier, providing an easy means to communicate with tenants to resolve several problems. Medical professionals can also attend to patients promptly and effectively through our doctor's answering services. We have practical and economical solutions ideal for your medical office.” No More Phone Tag offers a free 14-day trial of its call-answering services. People who want to know their apartment answering service costs can visit their website. About No More Phone Tag No More Phone Tag is a reliable answering service provider. Those who want to enlist the best medical answering services can consider them. author: Alex Kesler
title: Funeral procession to be held for K9 Bumi
text:
RICHLAND COUNTY, S.C. (WACH) — The Richland County Sheriff's Department has announced the funeral procession for K9 Officer Bumi.
The procession will begin on December 27 at 10 am.
Law enforcement will leave 1 Science Court and travel from Parklane Road, to Highway 277, to Elmwood Avenue, to Huger Street, to Gervais Street, to Meeting Street, and will end at 200 State Street in West Columbia.
The procession is for law enforcement only, but the community is invited to McAllister's Funeral Home.
READ MORE | [13-year-old among 2 arrested in fatal K9 Bumi shooting; 1 still wanted](https://wach.com/news/local/sheriff-leon-lott-to-provide-updates-on-k9-killing-richland-county-sheriffs-department-columbia-south-carolina)
Bumi was shot and killed Monday in the line of duty.
Deputies say a car was stolen in Columbia on Sunday at 9:30 a.m.
Deputies spotted the vehicle at 2:30 a.m. and pursued it, using stop sticks to deflate the tires. K9 Specialist Alan Ware and K9 Bumi were at the scene.
Bumi got out of Specialist Ware's sight and deputies heard gunshots. They rushed to the area and found Bumi, who was wearing his vest but had been shot at least three times.
A 16-year-old was arrested at the scene. He is charged with obstruction of justice, misprision, and a pickup order by DJJ.
The teen was on an ankle monitor that was not charged up, according to authorities.
A 13-year-old was arrested a day later.
According to authorities, the 13-year-old is accused of being the shooter.
The 13-year-old is charged with attempted murder, unlawful killing of a police dog, malicious injury to personal property over 10K, breach of peace high and aggravated nature, possession of a weapon under 18, unlawful carrying of a weapon, possession of a weapon during a violent crime, and possession of a stolen vehicle.
